creator: pruonckk@pruonckk.org
text:
I have a debian/sarge running with kernel 2.6.10, when i update to kernel
2.6.12-3  the apache work for some time, but, last week when i do a restart on
apache, the mod-ssl dont work anymore, i have made some tests with libssl,
apache2 (debian package) etc..., nothing with result, but, today, i do a test
changing my version of kernel to 2.6.10 again, and, apache work again, the error
message that i was is :  Starting web server: Apache2/usr/sbin/apache2ctl: line
100: 18578 Segmentation fault $HTTPD -k start -DSSL 

when i move a ssl.load of mods-enable to apache tree, the apache initiate
normally, so i think have some probmem, in apache (mod_ssl) with a kernel
2.6.12-3, if im wrong, sorry for this post!

Mike Tesliuk

Please report problems using Debian packages to Debian,
http://www.debian.org/Bugs/Reporting
creator: jorton@redhat.com
